author: alexandair
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Get-Command -foo
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
Get-Command : A parameter cannot be found that matches parameter name 'foo'.
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
You get an output like you've specified just `Get-Command`.
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell

The bug exists in the latest, but also previous versions of PowerShell Core and Windows PowerShell.
```

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
This is an unfortunate side effect of how `ValueFromRemainingArguments` works, related issue: #4624

`Get-Command` uses the parameter `-ArgumentList` as a way of finding the dynamic parameters for a command, e.g.:

```
PS> Get-Command Get-Item -Syntax

Get-Item [-Path] <string[]> [-Filter <string>] [-Include <string[]>] [-Exclude <string[]>]
[-Force] [-Credential <pscredential>] [-UseTransaction] [-Stream <string[]>]
[<CommonParameters>]

Get-Item -LiteralPath <string[]> [-Filter <string>] [-Include <string[]>] [-Exclude <string[]>]
[-Force] [-Credential <pscredential>] [-UseTransaction] [-Stream <string[]>]
[<CommonParameters>]

#53 PS> Get-Command Get-Item -Syntax -Path cert:

Get-Item [-Path] <string[]> [-Filter <string>] [-Include <string[]>] [-Exclude <string[]>]
[-Force] [-Credential <pscredential>] [-UseTransaction] [-CodeSigningCert]
[-DocumentEncryptionCert] [-SSLServerAuthentication] [-DnsName <DnsNameRepresentation>]
[-Eku <string[]>] [-ExpiringInDays <int>] [<CommonParameters>]

Get-Item -LiteralPath <string[]> [-Filter <string>] [-Include <string[]>] [-Exclude <string[]>]
[-Force] [-Credential <pscredential>] [-UseTransaction] [-CodeSigningCert]
[-DocumentEncryptionCert] [-SSLServerAuthentication] [-DnsName <DnsNameRepresentation>]
[-Eku <string[]>] [-ExpiringInDays <int>] [<CommonParameters>]
````

title: Get-Command doesn't fail when you specify a nonexistent parameter
